sen.j: 源 信（みなもと の まこと、弘仁元年（810年） - 貞観 (日本)10年閏12月28日 (旧暦)（869年2月13日））は平安時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Makoto (810 - February 13, 869) was a noble during the first half of the Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Makoto (810 - February 13, 869) was a noble during the first half of the Heian Period.

sen.j: 源氏の祖で初代源氏長者。
sen.e: He was the patriarch of the Minamoto clan and the eldest of the first generation Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 源氏 = Minamoto clan/Genji clan, 英辞郎 on the WEB、プログレッシブ和英辞典

sen.j: 父は嵯峨天皇、母は広井氏または広幡氏、藤井氏ともいう。
sen.e: His father was Emperor Saga, and his mother is said to have come from Hiroi clan, Hirohata clan or Fujii clan.
sen.cmt: 嵯峨天皇 = Emperor Saga, 英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇)

sen.j: 弘仁5年（814年）、源朝臣の姓を賜り、左京一条坊に貫付せられて戸主となった。
sen.e: In 814, he received the family name of MINAMOTO no Ason, and he was given Sakyo Ichijo-bo and he became the head of his clan.
sen.cmt: 左京一条坊 = Sakyo Ichijo-boUnconfirmed, Sakyo Ichijo-bo is probably a piece of land in the Sakyo Ichijo area in Kyoto given to MINAMOTO no Ason.

sen.j: 源常（ときわ）、源定（さだむ）、源融(とおる)という弟とともに嵯峨源氏と呼ばれ、朝廷内での一大勢力となる。
sen.e: Along with his brothers, MINAMOTO no Tokiwa, MINAMOTO no Sadamu and MINAMOTO no Toru, he was called the Saga Genji clan and he became very powerful within the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 嵯峨源氏 = Saga Genji clan, http://web.me.com/heli1/One_Hundred_Poems/14_Kawara.html

sen.j: 22歳で参議、天安 (日本)元年（857年）左大臣。
sen.e: He became a Sangi at the age of 22, and he became a Sadaijin in 857.
sen.cmt: 参議 = Sangi; 左大臣 = Sadaijin, Minister of the Left, http://web.me.com/heli1/One_Hundred_Poems/14_Kawara.html
sen.e: He became a Sangi at the age of 22, and he became a Sadaijin in 857.

sen.j: 貞観8年（866年）応天門の変で不仲であった大納言伴善男の誣告により放火の嫌疑を受け、邸を包囲され、絶望した家の人々が嘆き悲しむ様子が伴大納言絵詞に描かれている。
sen.e: In 866, during the Affair of Otenmon, he was charged with arson because of a false accusation by Dainagon TOMO no Yoshio, with who he did not get along, and TOMO no Dainagon ekotoba depicts the people in the besieged mansion wailing in desperation.

sen.cmt: TOMO→Tomo：ここでは、名字ではなく絵詞の名前なので、小文字Dainagon→ Dainagon (chief councilor of state)に変更しました。

sen.e: This incident gave Makoto a tremendous mental distress, and thereafter, he locked up his gate and confined himself to his mansion.

sen.e: On February 13, 869, he went hunting for a change of air, but he fell off the horse and fell into a deep mud.
